lv.emes.libraries.file_system

Class MS_TextFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.file_system.MS_TextFile

  • public class MS_TextFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Module provides common operations with files and folders. Public methods: -openForReading -close -readln -writeln -write -appendln -append -getFilename -importStringListFromFile -exportStringListToFile Static methods: -getProjectDirectory -fileExists -createEmptyFile -getResourceFileTextAsString
    Version:
    1.9.

        public MS_TextFile(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Parameters:
        aFilename - name of file, which will be processed by current object. If full path name is not provided, file will be created or will be searched in root directory of executable application.

    • Method Detail

      • openForReading

        public boolean openForReading()
        Opens file just for reading.
        Returns:
        true if file exists and is successfully opened.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes file. Doesn't matter if file was opened for reading or writing.

      • readln

        public java.lang.String readln()
        Reads one line from the file. If file isn't opened, method will open the file. For reading all the file by loop consider using construction: while ( (str = reader.readln()) != null) {...}!
        Returns:
        current line in file or null if end of file is reached or file is empty.

      • readln

        public java.lang.String readln(boolean aCloseAfterRead)
        Reads one line from the file. If file isn't opened, method will open the file. For reading all the file by loop consider using construction: while ( (str = reader.readln()) != null) {...}!
        Parameters:
        aCloseAfterRead - if true file will be close after successful reading of line.
        Returns:
        current line in file or null if end of file is reached or file is empty.

      • writeln

        public boolean writeln(java.lang.String aText)
        Writes the file contents by line that contains aText. If file exist, the contents of file is overridden. If file was already opened for reading, it will be closed and deleted, then recreated. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file appending is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be written to new line in file.
        Returns:
        true if writing successful.

      • write

        public boolean write(java.lang.String aText)
        Writes the file contents by text that contains aText adding it to a text where cursor (in file) stands. If file exist, the contents of file is overridden in first time open for writing. If file was already opened for reading, it will be closed and deleted, then recreated. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be written to line file where cursor stands.
        Returns:
        true if writing successful.

      • writeln

        public boolean writeln(java.lang.String aText,
                       boolean aCloseAfterWrite)
        Writes the file contents by line that contains aText. If file exist, the contents of file is overridden in first time open for writing. If file was already opened for reading, it will be closed and deleted, then recreated. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file writing is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be written to new line in file.
        aCloseAfterWrite - if true file will be close after successful appending of line.
        Returns:
        true if writing successful.

      • write

        public boolean write(java.lang.String aText,
                     boolean aCloseAfterWrite)

      • appendln

        public boolean appendln(java.lang.String aText)
        Appends the file contents by line that contains aText. If file doesn't exist, a new file is created. If file isn't opened, method opens a file for appending. After appending file is still opened. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file appending is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be appended to new line in file.
        Returns:
        true if appending successful.

      • append

        public boolean append(java.lang.String aText)
        Appends the file contents by text that contains aText. If file doesn't exist, a new file is created. If file isn't opened, method opens a file for appending. After appending file is still opened. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file appending is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be appended to existing line in file regarding on where cursor stands.
        Returns:
        true if appending successful.

      • appendln

        public boolean appendln(java.lang.String aText,
                        boolean aCloseAfterAppend)
        Appends the file contents by line that contains aText. If file doesn't exist, a new file is created. If file isn't opened, method opens a file for appending. After appending file is still opened unless aCloseAfterAppend = true. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file appending is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be appended to new line in file.
        aCloseAfterAppend - if true file will be close after successful appending of line.
        Returns:
        true if appending successful.

      • append

        public boolean append(java.lang.String aText,
                      boolean aCloseAfterAppend)
        Appends the file contents by text that contains aText. If file doesn't exist, a new file is created. If file isn't opened, method opens a file for appending. After appending file is still opened unless aCloseAfterAppend = true. Warning: changes in file will be saved only after file closing, so aCloseAfterWrite = true should be used when file appending is finished.
        Parameters:
        aText - text that will be appended to new line in file.
        aCloseAfterAppend - if true file will be close after successful appending of line.
        Returns:
        true if appending successful.

      • getFilename

        public java.lang.String getFilename()

      • importStringListFromFile

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> importStringListFromFile()
        Reads all the file and creates string list from contents line by line creating string list's element by element.
        Note: before and after this method file will do close to ensure that whole file will be read and that after this method file will be unlocked to append it, rewrite or even delete.
        Returns:
        list that contains all the lines of the file.
        See Also:
        close()

      • importStringListFromFile

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> importStringListFromFile(java.lang.String aFileName)
        Reads all the file and saves it into String type object list.
        Parameters:
        aFileName - path to text file.
        Returns:
        list in which each element represents a line in file.

      • exportStringListToFile

        public void exportStringListToFile(java.util.List<java.lang.String> aStringList)
        Exports list of strings to this particular text file.
        Parameters:
        aStringList - list of strings.

      • exportStringListToFile

        public static void exportStringListToFile(java.lang.String aFileName,
                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> aStringList)
        Exports list of strings to text file.
        Parameters:
        aFileName - path to a file that will be created.
        aStringList - list of string where each string represents a line in file.

      • getProjectDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getProjectDirectory()
        Returns:
        path to a directory where application is launched.
        See Also:
        MS_FileSystemTools.getProjectDirectory()

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.lang.String aFileName)

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.io.File aFile)

      • createEmptyFile

        public static boolean createEmptyFile(java.lang.String aFileName)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Atomically creates a new, empty file named by this abstract pathname if and only if a file with this name does not yet exist. The check for the existence of the file and the creation of the file if it does not exist are a single operation that is atomic with respect to all other filesystem activities that might affect the file. Note: this method should not be used for file-locking, as the resulting protocol cannot be made to work reliably. The FileLock facility should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        aFileName - - path + short filename, in other words: full path to file.
        Returns:
        true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - If an I/O error occurred

      • getFileTextAsString

        public static java.lang.String getFileTextAsString(java.lang.String aFilename,
                                                   java.lang.String aLineDelimiter)
        Returns content of given file as string (each line delimited with aLineDelimiter).
        Parameters:
        aFilename - path to a file.
        aLineDelimiter - "", " ", "\n" or ",", or even something else.
        Returns:
        whole file as plaintext where each line is divided by specified aLineDelimiter.

      • getResourceFileTextAsString

        public static java.lang.String getResourceFileTextAsString(java.lang.String filename)
        Returns content of given file as string as it is. Reads file as resource stream.
        Note: resource must be for read only and it must be prepared before launching any script that gets it.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to file as resource (do not use full filename, instead use path as it is located in classpath).
        Returns:
        whole file as plain text as it is.
